arm_group.description: All patient including all skin types with keloid or hypertrophic disease receiving Intralesional Cryotherapy

brief_summary.textblock:
This prospective evaluation studies the effectiveness of IL cryotherapy in treating keloids
      and hypertrophic scars in a large population of mixed Fitzpatrick skin types.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Evaluation of the Use of Intralesional Cryotherapy for Treatment of Keloid and Hypertrophic Scars

detailed_description.textblock:
Intralesional (IL) cryotherapy is a novel treatment for keloids and hypertrophic scars, in
      which the scar is frozen from inside. Published results are promising, however only
      Caucasian patient populations have been studied. This prospective evaluation studies the
      effectiveness of IL cryotherapy in treating keloids and hypertrophic scars in a large
      population of mixed Fitzpatrick skin types. All patients with keloid or hypertrophic scars
      meeting inclusion criteria were treated with a liquid nitrogen based device called Cryoshape
      Scar quality and possible recurrence are assessed pre- and postsurgery (3, 6 and 12 months)
      with objective devices determine scar color, scar elasticity, scar volume and patient's skin
      type. In addition, scars are evaluated using the Patient and Observer Scar Assessment Scale.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Keloids, defined as excessive scar tissue raised above skin level and proliferating
             beyond the confines of the original lesion

          -  Hypertrophic scars1 older than 12 months and insensitive to other treatments. Keloids
             were distinguished from hypertrophic scars based on the clinical judgment of
             experienced plastic surgeons and on the age of the scar (>1yr)

          -  A period between previous treatment and IL cryotherapy covered a minimum of 12 weeks

          -  Patients with all Fitzpatrick17 skin types

          -  Patients older than 10 years of age

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  pregnancy

          -  diabetes mellitus

study_pop.textblock: A mixed patient population with all Fitzpatrick skin types

intervention.description: Intralesional (IL) cryotherapy is a treatment for keloids and hypertrophic scars, in which the scar is frozen from inside with the use of a cryoneedle
intervention.other_name: Cryoneedle (CryoShape, Etgar Group International Ltd, Kfar Saba, Israel)

link.description: homepage VU medical center, hospital Amsterdam, the Netherlands

clinical_study.official_title: Intralesional Cryotherapy for Treatment of Keloid Scars: a Prospective Evaluation

other_outcome.description: Determined by creating a mold of the scar with dental putty
Redness (erythema) and pigmentation (melanin), which were measured using the DermaSpectrometer

performed by two experienced medical doctors and the patient using the Patient and Observer Scar Assessment Scale (POSAS). Each item of the POSAS was scored using a 10-step score, in which 10 reflected 'worst scar imaginable' and 1 indicated 'normal skin'

primary_outcome.description: Judgment of recurrence, defined as a growing, pruritic, nodular scar

reference.citation: Har-Shai Y, Amar M, Sabo E. Intralesional cryotherapy for enhancing the involution of hypertrophic scars and keloids. Plast Reconstr Surg. 2003 May;111(6):1841-52.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Scar elasticity, measured in two parameters: extension and elasticity
